turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm trying to track an order but the tracking number I received doesn't seem to be working. It's #12345ABCDE.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I'd be happy to help you track your order. Let me check the tracking number #12345ABCDE for you. One moment, please.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, thanks. I've been trying for two days and it just says 'Not Found' on the carrier's website. Starting to get a little frustrated!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your frustration. I see that the tracking number #12345ABCDE is associated with an order placed on July 10th. However, it appears there's been a slight delay in updating the tracking information. It's currently listed as 'Pre-Shipment'. I've contacted the shipping department to inquire about the delay.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Pre-shipment? That means it hasn't even left yet? I thought it was supposed to arrive today! Is there any estimate on when it will actually ship?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Yes, 'Pre-Shipment' means the shipping label has been created, but the package hasn't been scanned by the carrier yet. I'm afraid I don't have a precise estimate for when it will ship. The average time between label creation and initial scan is 1-3 business days. I recommend checking back tomorrow afternoon. Is there anything else I can help with?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I guess. So, if it *doesn't* update by tomorrow, what happens then? And why does this happen in the first place? Is your system just making up tracking numbers that aren't real?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: If the tracking doesn't update by tomorrow, please contact us again, and we'll escalate the issue to investigate further. This delay can sometimes occur due to high shipping volumes or logistical issues at the warehouse. The tracking number is valid; it's generated when the order is processed for shipping. The delay is with the physical package being received and scanned by the carrier, not an issue with the number itself.

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Alright, thanks for the explanation. I'll check again tomorrow.
